    $value[0]['question']
    <p>The “right of use” model of IFRS 16 does not have to be applied to leases that are short term  <i>(i.e. a lease with a term of 12 months or less from the commencement date). </i></p>
<p>Confirm that any leases for which this exemption has been claimed meet the qualifying criteria.</p>

    question => UTF-8 string (495) "<p>The “right of use” model of IFRS 16 does not have to be applied to leases...
    $value[1]['question']
    <p>The “right of use” model of IFRS 16 does not have to be applied to leases for which the underlying asset is of low value <i>(refer to IFRS 16 B3 -B8 for guidance).</i></p>
<p>Confirm that any leases for which this exemption has been claimed meet the qualifying criteria.</p>
<p><i>NB: the “low value” criteria is an absolute criteria, based on the underlying asset having a value, when new, of US$5,000 or less. Materiality <b> <u> does not</u> </b> come into the equation..</i></p>

    question => string (467) "<p>Ensure that the assessment of the lease term has taken into account each ...
    $value[2]['question']
    <p>Ensure that the assessment of the lease term has taken into account each of the following:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The non-cancellable period of the lease;</li>
    <li>Periods covered by an option to extend the lease if the lessee is reasonably certain to exercise that option; and</li>
    <li>Periods covered by an option to terminate the lease if the lessee is reasonably certain not to exercise that option.</li>
</ul>
<i>See IFRS 16.B37 - 40 for guidance.</i>

    question => UTF-8 string (511) "<p>The discount rate to be used when calculating the present value of the le...
    $value[7]['question']
    <p>The discount rate to be used when calculating the present value of the lease payments is either:</p>
<ul>
    <li>The interest rate implicit in the lease, if this rate can be easily determined; or</li>
    <li>The lessee’s incremental borrowing rate.  </li>
    <li>Periods covered by an option to terminate the lease if the lessee is reasonably certain not to exercise that option.</li>
</ul>
<p>Obtain appropriate evidence to support the discount rate used. </p>
<i>See IFRS 16.26 for detail. </i>

    question => string (351) "<p>Where there are changes to the lease payments (for example, as a result o...
    $value[8]['question']
    <p>Where there are changes to the lease payments (for example, as a result of a change in the expected lease term, or a change in the assessment of an option to purchase the underlying asset), ensure that the lease liability is remeasured and a corresponding adjustment to the right of use asset is made.</p>
<i>See IFRS 16.40 to 43 for guidance.</i>

    question => string (297) "<p>If there is a lease modification, ensure this is treated as a separate le...
    $value[9]['question']
    <p>If there is a lease modification, ensure this is treated as a separate lease only if both qualifying criteria in paragraph 44a have been met.</p>
<p>If the criteria are not met, ensure that the modification has been accounted for correctly.</p>
<i>Refer to IFRS 16.44 to 46 for guidance. </i>

    ⇄⧉
    question => UTF-8 string (834) "<p>IFRS 16 is applied using one of the following two methods</p> <p>(a) The ...
    $value[10]['question']
    <p>IFRS 16 is applied using one of the following two methods</p>
<p>(a)	The “retrospective” method: apply the Standard retrospectively to each prior reporting period presented in accordance with IAS 8 <i>Accounting Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors, </i> subject to the expedients in paragraph IFRS 16.C3; or</p>
<p>(b)	The “cumulative effect” method: retrospectively with the cumulative effect of initially applying IFRS 16 recognised as an adjustment to the opening balance of retained earnings (or other component of equity, as appropriate) of the annual reporting period that includes the date of initial application. </p>
<i>The date of initial application is the start of the reporting period in which an entity first applies this Standard (i.e. 1 January 2019 for a 31 December 2019 year-end);</i>

    ⇄⧉
    question => UTF-8 string (1429) "<p>Obtain a reconciliation that shows the impact of first-time adoption of I...
    $value[13]['question']
    <p>Obtain a reconciliation that shows the impact of first-time adoption of IFRS 16. This should include:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Narrative explanation of how the first-time adoption has been treated (i.e. full retrospective application or the “cumulative effect” approach);</li>
    <li>Narrative explanation of the changes made on first time adoption; </li>
    <li><b><u>If the retrospective method has been used:</u> </b> <br>For the preceding period, an analysis of each line item in the financial statements affected by the change, showing:
        <ul>
            <li>The figure as originally stated under IAS 17;</li>
            <li>Any reclassification adjustments made;</li>
            <li>Any remeasurement changes from applying the IFRS 16 requirements;</li>
            <li>The restated figure under IFRS 16.</li>
            <li>This should also include a reconciliation of retained earnings.</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
    <li><b><u>If the cumulative effect method has been used: </u></b><br>For the current period, an analysis of the difference between: 
        <ul>
            <li>operating lease commitments disclosed at the prior period end, discounted using the incremental borrowing rate; and</li>
            <li>the lease liability recognised on initial application.</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
</ul>
<p>A reconciliation of opening retained earnings should be also be obtained. </p>
    ⇄extent => string (0) ""

    $value[17]['question']
    <p>Where grants are non-governmental in nature they must be recognised in the profit or loss section of the Statement of Comprehensive Income as soon as the conditions imposed by the grant are satisfied.  Ensure this has occurred.</p>
<i>NB: Recognition in income could be as the asset is constructed, when the asset is purchased or over a specific period of time where there are conditions relating to the usage of the asset.</i>
